Class Perspective

Kernel ANSI C Camera calibration and 3D->2D/2D->3D perspective functions, Last updated 11/31/2000. More...

Data Structures

struct  TCameraMatrix
 This is the camera matrix explained in Gonzales and Woods. More...

struct  TCameraParameters
 The camera parameters derived in the PhD Thesis "Industrial Vision" by Ole Knudsen, 1997, chapter 2.2. More...

 For a given position (x,y) a new radial corrected position is returned, that is the position in a corresponding image without radial distortions.

Detailed Description

Kernel ANSI C Camera calibration and 3D->2D/2D->3D perspective functions, Last updated 11/31/2000.

These functions are part of the Image Processing Library IPL98.

Version:
1.32
Author:
Ivar Balslev (ivb@mip.sdu.dk), Brian Kirstein (kirstein@protana.com) and René Dencker Eriksen (edr@mip.sdu.dk)

Function Documentation

void k_Calc3DTo2D (  T3DFloat    w,
const TCameraMatrix *    pMat,
T2DFloat *    pPnt
) 
 

Finds the 2D position in image from a given 3D position and the camera matrix.

Parameters:
w  World coordinate.
pMat  Precalculated camera matrix.
pPnt  Position in image returned in this parameter.

Definition at line 338 of file kernel_perspective.c.

References TCameraMatrix::a11, TCameraMatrix::a12, TCameraMatrix::a13, TCameraMatrix::a14, TCameraMatrix::a21, TCameraMatrix::a22, TCameraMatrix::a23, TCameraMatrix::a24, TCameraMatrix::a41, TCameraMatrix::a42, TCameraMatrix::a43, FLOAT32, T3DFloat::x, T2DFloat::x, T3DFloat::y, T2DFloat::y, and T3DFloat::z.

Referenced by k_Calc3DTo2DRad(), and k_Calc3DTo2DRadOld().

void k_Calc3DTo2DRad (  T3DFloat    w,
const TCameraMatrix *    pMat,
double    k,
T2DFloat *    pPnt,
FLOAT32    CenterX,
FLOAT32    CenterY
) 
 

Finds the 2D position in image from a given 3D position, the camera matrix and the distortion parameter k.

Use this function when working with an image not corrected for the radial distortion and a camera matrix and k-value calculated by one of the functions k_CalibrateWithRadialDist() or k_FindMarksAutoGlobalThreshold(). For a given 3D world position you will get the corresponding point in your original radial distorted image.

Parameters:
w  World coordinate.
pMat  Precalculated camera matrix.
k  Distortion parameter, calculated by k_CalibrateWithRadialDist().
pPnt  Position in image returned in this parameter.
CenterX  Half image width used as center for radial distortion.
CenterY  Half image height used as center for radial distortion.

Definition at line 503 of file kernel_perspective.c.

References FLOAT32, k_Calc3DTo2D(), T2DFloat::x, and T2DFloat::y.

void k_Calc3DTo2DRadOld (  T3DFloat    w,
const TCameraMatrix *    pMat,
double    k,
T2DFloat *    pPnt,
const TImage *    pImg
) 
 

IMPORTANT: Only kept for backward compatibility, use other functions! Finds the 2D position in image from a given 3D position, the camera matrix and the distortion parameter k.

Use this function when working with an image not corrected for the radial distortion and a camera matrix and k-value calculated by one of the functions k_CalibrateWithRadialDist() or k_FindMarksAutoGlobalThreshold(). For a given 3D world position you will get the corresponding point in your original radial distorted image.

Parameters:
w  World coordinate.
pMat  Precalculated camera matrix.
k  Distortion parameter, calculated by k_CalibrateWithRadialDist().
pPnt  Position in image returned in this parameter.
pImg  The function needs the image to calculate the center (width/2, height/2).

bool k_Calibrate (  unsigned int    np,
const T3DFloat *    pWorld,
const T2DFloat *    pCcd,
TCameraMatrix *    pMat
) 
 

Calibrates the camera matrix given in Gonzalez & Woods page 67.

Parameters:
np  Number of 3D world cordinates given in the parameter array World.
pWorld  Array containing 3D world coordinates (must be same size as pCcd array).
pCcd  Array containing the 2D image points (must be same size as pWorld array).
pMat  The camera parameters are returned in this variable.
Returns :
False, if np<6 or if one of the given parameters is a NULL pointer.
See also:
k_CalibrateCamera

Definition at line 214 of file kernel_perspective.c.

References TCameraMatrix::a11, TCameraMatrix::a12, TCameraMatrix::a13, TCameraMatrix::a14, TCameraMatrix::a21, TCameraMatrix::a22, TCameraMatrix::a23, TCameraMatrix::a24, TCameraMatrix::a31, TCameraMatrix::a32, TCameraMatrix::a33, TCameraMatrix::a34, TCameraMatrix::a41, TCameraMatrix::a42, TCameraMatrix::a43, TCameraMatrix::a44, k_AddFileAndLine, k_EmptyString(), k_InitString(), k_ShowMessage(), T3DFloat::x, T2DFloat::x, T3DFloat::y, T2DFloat::y, and T3DFloat::z.

bool k_CalibrateCamera (  const T3D2DPoints *    pPointSets,
TCameraMatrix *    pMat
) 
 

Calibrates the camera matrix exactly as the function k_Calibrate() does, but this function takes a T3D2DPoints structure containing the 3D world coordinates and the 2D ccd coordinates.

Parameters:
pPointSets  3D and 2D corresponding coordinates, all entries must be complete, ie. an entry where either the 2D or 3D point is not used is not accepted.
Returns :
False, if corresponding point sets is less than 6, if one of the given parameters is a NULL pointer, or if the pPointSets contains non complete entries.
See also:
k_Calibrate

Definition at line 77 of file kernel_perspective.c.

References TCameraMatrix::a11, TCameraMatrix::a12, TCameraMatrix::a13, TCameraMatrix::a14, TCameraMatrix::a21, TCameraMatrix::a22, TCameraMatrix::a23, TCameraMatrix::a24, TCameraMatrix::a31, TCameraMatrix::a32, TCameraMatrix::a33, TCameraMatrix::a34, TCameraMatrix::a41, TCameraMatrix::a42, TCameraMatrix::a43, TCameraMatrix::a44, k_AddFileAndLine, k_EmptyString(), k_GetTotal3D2DPointSetsInUse(), k_InitString(), k_ShowMessage(), T3D2DPoints::NumberOfSets, TSinglePointSet::Pnt2D, TSinglePointSet::Pnt3D, T3D2DPoints::pSet, T3DFloat::x, T2DFloat::x, T3DFloat::y, T2DFloat::y, and T3DFloat::z.

Referenced by k_CalibrateWithRadialDist(), and k_CalibrateWithRadialDistOld().

bool k_CalibrateWithRadialDist (  T3D2DPoints *    pPointSets,
TCameraMatrix *    pMat,
double *    k,
FLOAT32    CenterX,
FLOAT32    CenterY
) 
 

Performs a normal calibration as the corresponding k_Calibrate() function in IPL98.

In addition to that a radial distortion parameter k is estimated, see general comments for more information. Note: If you don't want distortion corrections just use the normal k_Calibrate() function.

Parameters:
pPointSets  Contains the sets of corresponding 2D and 3D coordinates, at least 6 must be present.
pMat  The camera parameters are returned in this variable.
k  The distortion parameter is returned in this variable.
CenterX  Half image width used as center for radial distortion.
CenterY  Half image height used as center for radial distortion.
Returns :
False, if number of point sets is less than 6, if one of the given parameters is a NULL pointer, or if the pPointSets contains non complete entries.

Definition at line 394 of file kernel_perspective.c.

References FLOAT32, k_AddFileAndLine, k_CalibrateCamera(), k_Copy3D2DPoints(), k_Empty3D2DPoints(), k_EmptyString(), k_GetPosRadRemoved(), k_GetTotal3D2DPointSetsInUse(), k_Init3D2DPoints(), k_InitString(), k_SetPoint2DIn3D2DPoints(), k_ShowMessage(), T3D2DPoints::NumberOfSets, TSinglePointSet::Pnt2D, T3D2DPoints::pSet, T2DFloat::x, and T2DFloat::y.

bool k_CalibrateWithRadialDistOld (  T3D2DPoints *    pPointSets,
TCameraMatrix *    pMat,
double *    k,
const TImage *    pImg
) 
 

IMPORTANT: Only kept for backward compatibility, use other functions! Performs a normal calibration as the corresponding k_Calibrate() function in IPL98.

In addition to that a radial distortion parameter k is estimated, see general comments for more information. Note: If you don't want distortion corrections just use the normal k_Calibrate() function.

Parameters:
pPointSets  Contains the sets of corresponding 2D and 3D coordinates, at least 6 must be present.
pMat  The camera parameters are returned in this variable.
k  The distortion parameter is returned in this variable.
pImg  The function needs the image to calculate the center (width/2, height/2).
Returns :
False, if number of point sets is less than 6, if one of the given parameters is a NULL pointer, or if the pPointSets contains non complete entries.

const TCameraMatrix *    pMat,
T3DFloat *    pDir
) 
 

Calculates direction from p through Pinhole.

Parameters:
p  Position in 2D image.
pMat  Precalculated camera matrix.
pDir  3D direction returned in this parameter.

Definition at line 346 of file kernel_perspective.c.

References TCameraMatrix::a11, TCameraMatrix::a12, TCameraMatrix::a13, TCameraMatrix::a21, TCameraMatrix::a22, TCameraMatrix::a23, TCameraMatrix::a41, TCameraMatrix::a42, TCameraMatrix::a43, FLOAT32, T3DFloat::x, T2DFloat::x, T2DFloat::y, T3DFloat::y, and T3DFloat::z.

T2DInt k_GetMaxRadialDisplacement (  double    k,
FLOAT32    CenterX,
FLOAT32    CenterY
) 
 

Returns the maximum radial distortion displacement for a postion in image with given distortion parameter k.

Done by displacing a corner position which is the position furthest away from center.

Parameters:
pImg  The function needs the image to calculate the center (width/2, height/2).
k  Distortion parameter.
CenterX  Half image width used as center for radial distortion.
CenterY  Half image height used as center for radial distortion.
Returns :
Maximum displacement relative to center of image.

Definition at line 512 of file kernel_perspective.c.

double    k
)

Done by displacing a corner position which is the position furthest away from center.

Parameters:
pImg  The function needs the image to calculate the center (width/2, height/2).
k  Distortion parameter.
Returns :
Maximum displacement relative to center of image.

References TImage::Height, k_Round, TImage::Width, T2DInt::x, and T2DInt::y.

T2DFloat k_GetPosInverseRad (  FLOAT32    xr,
FLOAT32    yr,
double    k,
FLOAT32    CenterX,
FLOAT32    CenterY
) 
 

For a given position (x,y) a new inverse radial corrected position is returned, that is the position in a corresponding image with radial distortions.

Center of radial distortion is assumed to be center of image. This functionality is the opposite of k_GetPosRadRemoved().

Parameters:
xr  The position in horisontal direction.
yr  The position in vertical direction.
k  The distortion parameter calculated by k_CalibrateWithRadialDist().
CenterX  Half image width used as center for radial distortion.
CenterY  Half image height used as center for radial distortion.
Returns :
Inverse radial corrected 2d position.
See also:
k_GetPosRadRemoved

Definition at line 674 of file kernel_perspective.c.

References FLOAT32, T2DFloat::x, and T2DFloat::y.

T2DFloat k_GetPosInverseRadCOld (  FLOAT32    xr,
FLOAT32    yr,
FLOAT32    CenterX,
FLOAT32    CenterY,
double    k
) 
 

IMPORTANT: Only kept for backward compatibility, use other functions! Same as k_GetPosInverseRad, but here the center of image is given as parameters instead of an image.

Parameters:
xr  The position in horisontal direction.
yr  The position in vertical direction.
k  The distortion parameter calculated by k_CalibrateWithRadialDist().
Returns :
Inverse radial corrected 2d position.
See also:
k_GetPosInverseRad , k_GetPosRadRemoved

Definition at line 1463 of file kernel_perspective.c.

References FLOAT32, TImage::Height, TImage::Width, T2DFloat::x, and T2DFloat::y.

T2DFloat k_GetPosRadRemoved (  FLOAT32    x,
FLOAT32    y,
double    k,
FLOAT32    CenterX,
FLOAT32    CenterY
) 
 

For a given position (x,y) a new radial corrected position is returned, that is the position in a corresponding image without radial distortions.

Center of radial distortion is assumed to be center of image. The inverse correction is performed by the function k_GetPosInverseRad().

Parameters:
x  The position in horisontal direction.
y  The position in vertical direction.
k  The distortion parameter calculated by k_CalibrateWithRadialDist().
CenterX  Half image width used as center for radial distortion.
CenterY  Half image height used as center for radial distortion.
Returns :
Radial corrected 2d position.
See also:
k_GetPosInverseRad

Definition at line 662 of file kernel_perspective.c.

References FLOAT32, T2DFloat::x, and T2DFloat::y.

FLOAT32    y,
FLOAT32    CenterX,
FLOAT32    CenterY,
double    k
) 
 

IMPORTANT: Only kept for backward compatibility, use other functions! Same as k_GetPosRadRemoved, but here the center of image is given as parameters instead of an image.

Parameters:
x  The position in horisontal direction.
y  The position in vertical direction.
CenterX  Horisontal center (width/2 of image)
CenterY  Vertical center (height/2 of image).
k  The distortion parameter calculated by k_CalibrateWithRadialDist().
Returns :
Radial corrected 2d position.
See also:
k_GetPosRadRemoved

bool k_MatrixToParameters (  const TCameraMatrix *    pMat,
TCameraParameters *    pPar
) 
 

Derives the camera parameters using the method presented in the PhD Thesis "Industrial Vision" by Ole Knudsen, 1997, chapter 2.2.

Parameters:
pMat  Precalculated camera matrix.
pPar  The camera parameters are returned in this variable.
Returns :
False, if no solution is found to angle a,b,c or beta.
Version:
0.5
Author:
Implementation by Brian Kirstein Ramsgaard (kirstein@protana.com)

Definition at line 702 of file kernel_perspective.c.

References TCameraParameters::a, TCameraMatrix::a11, TCameraMatrix::a12, TCameraMatrix::a13, TCameraMatrix::a14, TCameraMatrix::a21, TCameraMatrix::a22, TCameraMatrix::a23, TCameraMatrix::a24, TCameraMatrix::a41, TCameraMatrix::a42, TCameraMatrix::a43, TCameraParameters::b, TCameraParameters::beta, TCameraParameters::c, TCameraParameters::dx, TCameraParameters::dy, TCameraParameters::dz, TCameraParameters::f, TCameraParameters::FocalLength, k_AddFileAndLine, k_EmptyString(), k_InitString(), k_ShowMessage(), TCameraParameters::p, PI, TCameraParameters::xh, and TCameraParameters::yh.

bool k_ParametersToMatrix (  const TCameraParameters *    pPar,
TCameraMatrix *    pMat
) 
 

Builds the camera matrix form the camera parameters using the method presented in the PhD Thesis "Industrial Vision" by Ole Knudsen, 1997, chapter 2.2.

Parameters:
pPar  Precalculated camera parameters.
pMat  The camera matrix is returned in this variable.
Returns :
False, if the value of matrix element a44 is zero.
Version:
0.5
Author:
Implementation by Brian Kirstein Ramsgaard (kirstein@protana.com)

References TCameraParameters::a, TCameraParameters::b, TCameraParameters::beta, TCameraParameters::c, TCameraParameters::dx, TCameraParameters::dy, TCameraParameters::dz, TCameraParameters::FocalLength, TCameraParameters::p, PI, TCameraParameters::xh, and TCameraParameters::yh.

bool k_RemoveRadialDistortion (  TImage *    pDest,
TImage *    pSource,
double    k,
bool    PreserveImageSize
) 
 

Removes the radial distortion from the image.

Parameters:
pDest  Destination of new image, may be the same as pSource. Note: In case of same source and destination the algorithm is a bit slower.
pSource  Source image, may be the same as pDest. Note: In case of same source and destination the algorithm is a bit slower.
k  Distortion parameter, calculated by k_CalibrateWithRadialDist().
PreserveImageSize  if true, the destination image has same dimensions as source. Otherwise the new image will have the dimension needed to represent the radial corrected image without loss of information.
Returns :
False if pImg is not an 8 bit gray tone image or if pMat is a NULL pointer

Definition at line 520 of file kernel_perspective.c.
